alert.note: Alert for Grant; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 10:13PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN GRANT AND OWEN COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM EDT... At 1010 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles northeast of New Castle, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Owenton, Corinth, Monterey, Gratz, Stewartsville, Elk Lake, Beechwood, Long Ridge, Natlee, New Liberty, Twin Bridges, Squiresville, Keefer, Needmore, New Columbus, Holbrook, Elmer Davis Lake, Lawrenceville and Gest. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 144 and 149. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
